docs.snippet: Having already split with Mr. Trump over endorsing Paul Ryan, Mr. Pence told a Virginia television news station he would also support two snubbed Republican senators....
docs.lead_paragraph: Having already split with Mr. Trump over endorsing Paul Ryan, Mr. Pence told a Virginia television news station he would also support two snubbed Republican senators.
docs.abstract: Republican vice presidential nominee Mike Pence, breaking rank against Donald Trump for second time, endorses several Republican senators running for re-election that Trump had previously snubbed.

headline.main: Donald Trump and Mike Pence Again Diverge on Endorsements
headline.print_headline: Pence Breaks Ranks With Trump, Again, to Support Snubbed Republican Senators

byline.contributor: Alexander Burns reported from Portland, and Noah Remnick from Raleigh, N.C. John Corrales contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and NOAH REMNICK

docs.snippet: Mr. Kirk is among Republican incumbents who want to put distance between themselves and Donald Trump, but in doing so, they risk alienating base voters....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Kirk is among Republican incumbents who want to put distance between themselves and Donald Trump, but in doing so, they risk alienating base voters.
docs.abstract: Sen Mark S Kirk of Illinois becomes first member of Congress to rescind his support for presidential nominee Donald J Trump during his tough re-election campaign against Democrat Tammy Duckworth; move could further alienate voters who question Kirk's credentials as Republican.

headline.main: Mark Kirk in Electoral Vise as Republican in Illinois Senate Race
headline.print_headline: In Illinois Race, an Imperiled Republican Finds Himself in an Electoral Vise

headline.main: Italy PM Hints He Wants to Host Clinton at G7 Meeting
headline.print_headline: Italy PM Hints He Wants to Host Clinton at G7 Meeting

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama confirmed on Thursday that Donald Trump will get national security briefings ahead of the November election, but he warned the Republican candidate, whom he has called "unfit" for office, that information from the meetings m...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama confirmed on Thursday that Donald Trump will get national security briefings ahead of the November election, but he warned the Republican candidate, whom he has called "unfit" for office, that information from the meetings must be kept secret.

headline.main: Obama Warns Trump Not to Spread Details of Security Briefings
headline.print_headline: Obama Warns Trump Not to Spread Details of Security Briefings

docs.snippet: Donald Trump endorsed House Speaker Paul Ryan late Friday, ending a four-day standoff between the GOP's most powerful men that exposed deepening concerns about the New York billionaire's presidential candidacy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump endorsed House Speaker Paul Ryan late Friday, ending a four-day standoff between the GOP's most powerful men that exposed deepening concerns about the New York billionaire's presidential candidacy.

headline.main: Trump Ends Standoff With Ryan, Strains to Fix Split GOP
headline.print_headline: Trump Ends Standoff With Ryan, Strains to Fix Split GOP

docs.snippet: Republican Donald Trump acted to steer his White House campaign back into favor with his party's establishment on Friday by endorsing U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan and two Republican senators seeking re-election, after expressing...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Donald Trump acted to steer his White House campaign back into favor with his party's establishment on Friday by endorsing U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan and two Republican senators seeking re-election, after expressing coolness toward them earlier this week.

headline.main: Trump Endorses Ryan, Senators in Effort to Right Campaign Ship
headline.print_headline: Trump Endorses Ryan, Senators in Effort to Right Campaign Ship
